interactions.mechanism: Both affect hemostasis through different mechanisms; aspirin inhibits platelet aggregation while warfarin inhibits clotting factors
interactions.clinical_effect: Significantly increased risk of bleeding, including potentially fatal hemorrhage
interactions.management: Avoid combination if possible. If both required, use lowest aspirin dose (81mg) and monitor INR closely

interactions.mechanism: NSAIDs inhibit platelet function and may displace warfarin from protein binding sites
interactions.clinical_effect: Increased bleeding risk and potential for serious GI hemorrhage
interactions.management: Avoid NSAIDs with warfarin. Use acetaminophen for pain if needed

interactions.mechanism: NSAIDs inhibit platelet function and may displace warfarin from protein binding
interactions.clinical_effect: Increased bleeding risk and potential for serious GI hemorrhage
interactions.management: Avoid combination. Consider acetaminophen or topical analgesics

interactions.mechanism: ACE inhibitors reduce aldosterone secretion, decreasing potassium excretion
interactions.clinical_effect: Risk of hyperkalemia with cardiac arrhythmia potential
interactions.management: Monitor potassium levels regularly; avoid potassium supplements unless hypokalemic

interactions.mechanism: Both drugs can increase potassium levels through different mechanisms
interactions.management: Monitor potassium closely if combination necessary; consider dose adjustments

interactions.mechanism: Both can contribute to lactic acidosis; alcohol impairs gluconeogenesis
interactions.clinical_effect: Increased risk of lactic acidosis and hypoglycemia
interactions.management: Limit alcohol consumption; avoid binge drinking

interactions.mechanism: Gemfibrozil inhibits glucuronidation and OATP1B1 transport of statins
interactions.clinical_effect: Significantly increased risk of myopathy and rhabdomyolysis
interactions.management: Avoid combination. If fibrate needed, use fenofibrate instead

interactions.mechanism: Clarithromycin is a strong CYP3A4 inhibitor, increasing statin levels
interactions.clinical_effect: Increased risk of myopathy and rhabdomyolysis
interactions.management: Use azithromycin instead; if clarithromycin necessary, hold or reduce statin dose

interactions.mechanism: Omeprazole inhibits CYP2C19, reducing conversion of clopidogrel to active metabolite
interactions.clinical_effect: Reduced antiplatelet effect with increased cardiovascular event risk
interactions.management: Use pantoprazole or H2 blocker instead of omeprazole

interactions.mechanism: Decreased renal clearance of methotrexate by penicillins
interactions.management: Monitor for methotrexate toxicity; consider alternative antibiotic

interactions.mechanism: Both increase serotonin levels; fluoxetine inhibits tramadol metabolism
interactions.clinical_effect: Risk of serotonin syndrome and seizures
interactions.management: Avoid combination if possible; use alternative analgesic

interactions.mechanism: Ciprofloxacin inhibits CYP1A2 metabolism of theophylline
interactions.clinical_effect: Increased theophylline levels with seizure and arrhythmia risk
interactions.management: Monitor theophylline levels; reduce dose by 30-50% or use alternative antibiotic
